inn1.comm: 129 kph, full and just outside off as Unadkat looks for some inswing
128 kph, gets a hint of inswing as this full delivery goes past the stumps, with Finch shouldering arms
126 kph, beautiful ball, pitches this on a length and just outside off as it tails back in on the way to the keeper
back of a length on a leg stump line and coming in. Finch tries to flick it away, but to no avail
126 kph, fuller length and swinging in as Finch clips this through midwicket for a single to get off the mark
130 kph, full again and swinging away from Hughes as he shoulders arms. Great opening over from Unadkat with just 1 coming off the over
right on the money straight away as Shami spears this on the pads, and goes up for the appeal once the ball thuds in, but was always going down the leg side
140 kph, good speeds from Shami, this one pitches outside off with slight movement away as it is defended on the front foot
139 kph, short from Shami and Finch dismisses this from his presence with a pull in front of square for a boundary
139 kph, back of a length again as Finch tries to clip this away behind square on the leg side

140 kph, back of a length and swings in slightly upon pitching. Finch plays outside of the line and the ball goes through the gate between bat and pad to remove the dangerous opening bat. Huge wicket for India as Finch has been consistently giving solid starts to Australia throughout the series

138 kph, length ball that just shaves outside off stump as Watson, keen to play without the bat, allows it through to the keeper. But this was very close. Shami and Unadkat have set the tone here for India
125 kph, up in the blockhole as Hughes covers the line competently
129 kph, back of a length outside off and tailing away slightly. Hughes defends this off the back foot
126 kph, full and going down the leg side as Hughes looks to maneuver this through midwicket for a single
126 kph, length ball outside off which Hughes defends on the front foot through to cover for one
130 kph, back of a length and defended on the back foot
128 kph, length ball on middle and off which Watson defends resolutely
140 kph, back of a length delivery on middle and off which Hughes defends off the back foot
141 kph, back of a length and getting appreciable movement away from the batsman as Hughes flashes at this square off the wicket, but finds the fielder at point
140 kph, fuller length on the pads which Hughes clips through midwicket for a couple as he hits this to the right of short midwicket
138 kph, back of a length which Hughes covers with ease
139 kph, fuller length just outside off as Hughes defends on the front foot

138 kph, full and just outside off as Hughes pushes this to mid on, who comes in and fires in a throw to the non-strikers, which hits directly and richochets to the leg side, but luckily someone is covering there so no extra run is given
127 kph, length ball which Hughes gets on the back foot to cut away through point, but finds the fielder
129 kph, back of a length which Hughes eases through midwicket for one
127 kph, Watson finally finds the gap as he cuts away Unadkat behind point and in front of third man for a boundary
131 kph, fuller length just outside off which Watson covers without too much difficulty
113 kph, slower ball up in the blockhole which Watson sees off manfully
128 kph, back of a length and clipped off the pads to the square leg boundary for the second four of the over
140 kph, length ball going outside off as Hughes leans into a drive through extra-cover
140 kph, fuller length ball which Hughes short-arm pulls off the back foot behind square, beating the incoming third man to the boundary as he makes a valiant attempt
140 kph, fuller length just outside off which Hughes gets forward to

139 kph, back of a length which rises sharply as Hughes hangs his bat, caught in mid-stride, with the ball taking the outside edge through to Dhoni who completes a fine take. Second wicket down and Shami is on a roll

138 kph, dropped back of a length again and Bailey, surprised by the length, gets an outside edge which carries to Kohli at third slip, who in mid-dive makes a hash of it. Huge missed opportunity there from the Indians
this one is splayed wide down the leg side
138 kph, length ball going down the pads which Bailey clips through midwicket
126 kph, back of a length which Watson defends off the back foot
124 kph, full and just outside off as Watson looks for the extra-cover drive
129 kph, fuller length just outside off which Watson gets forward to
117 kph, slower ball on middle which Watson directs straight to long off
130 kph, length ball on the pads which is clipped away to the leg side
126 kph, full and on the pads which Bailey fails to whisk away
138 kph, fuller length outside off which Watson defends on the front foot
142 kph, back of a length and defended to the leg side
138 kph, on the money again as Watson prods forward to defend on the front foot
139 kph, length ball on middle and leg which Watson punches through long on for a sweetly timed boundary. Seems the break has done wonders for the allrounder
140 kph, back of a length outside off which is worked away to short cover

139 kph, length ball swinging in as Watson looks for the booming cover drive, but the ball jags in just enough to find the gap. What a beauty from Shami! Third wicket for him and Australia in serious trouble now
125 kph, shortish delivery just outside off and tailing in. Allowed through to the keeper
124 kph, full and in the blockhole as Bailey pushes this down to long on for a couple
127 kph, fuller length just outside off which Voges tries to squirt away behind square, but to no avail
124 kph, pitched outside off and shapes away from Voges on the way to the keeper
126 kph, length ball on and around off which is defended off the back foot
128 kph, shortish delivery outside off which is given the treatment with a back-foot punch through extra cover for four
136 kph, fuller length delivery with some movement away upon pitching outside off
140 kph, fantastic line again from Shami, this time nipping in. The batsmen are having some difficulty picking Shami here
143 kph, fastest of the innings so far as Shami slips in the bouncer which Bailey swivels away in avoidance
141 kph, length ball just outside off and swinging away, which Bailey works away to the off side
139 kph, fuller length again and jagging in a bit as it passes through to the keeper
fires in the short one which rises upon pitching, with Voges going for the hook. The Indians think Voges has got a touch on the ball, and go up to appeal, but the umpire is having none of it
123 kph, gentle loosener outside off which Bailey capitalises on with a lovely drive through extra-cover for a boundary
127 kph, back of a length outside off which Bailey tries to cut away through point, but finds Yuvraj who does a great job reining it in
127 kph, Vinay is messing up the good work off the previous bowlers as he tosses this at a friendly length which allows Bailey to rock back and power through midwicket for four
129 kph, outside off and Bailey gets forward to defend
126 kph, Vinay is not getting it. Fires it short again as Bailey rocks back to pull this emphatically to the long on boundary
129 kph, length ball outside off which Bailey tries to squirt away square on the off side
140 kph, full, straight and on the money. Voges clips this through midwicket for none
139 kph, gets the line wrong as he spears this down the leg side, which Voges helps along with glee
140 kph, shortish delivery outside off which Voges tries to cut away, but finds point
140 kph, Voges clips this fuller length delivery straight to square leg
138 kph, length ball which Voges covers without too much difficulty
139 kph, Bailey allows this back of a length delivery through to the keeper
85 kph, fires in a lower full toss which is clipped down to long on
84 kph, length ball on middle which Voges defends manfully
85 kph, Ashwin pitches this on middle and leg which Voges pushes to the leg side
86 kph, fired in a bit quicker on the pads which Bailey is able to work away through midwicket for a couple
84 kph, this one is a bit short as Bailey is able to cut it away behind point for two
87 kph, quicker delivery on the pads which Bailey eases behind square on the leg side
127 kph, better line, fuller length and just outside off as Bailey defends on the front foot
125 kph, shortish length that is cut away by Bailey on the off side
127 kph, back of a length outside off which Voges works away with ease through cover
127 kph, shortish length which Bailey gets on the back foot to defend
129 kph, back of a length on middle and leg which Bailey gets on top off
127 kph, length ball on middle and leg which Bailey whisks away to the leg side for a couple
pitched on a length on and around off which Voges chips through long on
84 kph, Bailey works this away through midwicket for one

90 kph, quicker delivery on middle and leg which Voges gets on one knee to paddle round the corner, but misses the ball. The ball thuds into the front pad, and Ashwin goes up instantly, with the umpire confirming the decision. Big wicket for India as they look to take out the big guns early in hopes of keeping the chase minimal
86 kph, flighted outside off stump as Maxwell gets off the mark with a gentle clip through the leg side
80 kph, Bailey covers the line without too much worry
88 kph, darted in with the ball going across Bailey, as he steers it through third man
charges in and bowls a back of a length ball on middle, which is easily tucked away in through midwicket
seemed a little slower from Vinay as Maxwell waits for it and clips the fullish ball on middle and leg behind square
lots better there. Though he is still targeting a shortish length, this was a shade outside off stump and is defended
127kph, kept on and around the off stump and Maxwell gets behind the line and blocks
128kph, a touch fuller this time but Maxwell is happy to camp on the back foot and punch it to mid-on
another careful defence to end the over. Vinay is reluctant to bowl too many balls on the fuller side as Maxwell has ample time to get back and keep it out as the players have a bit of a drink
84.5kph, one a good length outside off as Bailey moves across and punches it back to the bowler

oh, big appeal for leg before. Bailey was on the sweep as Ashwin bowled this one slower and fuller. The umpire judges the ball would not have turned enough to clip the stumps with the angle from around the wicket
tries to deftly nudge it past the leg slip but the ball beats him and takes the thigh pad and trickles over to that fielder
another one on the pads from Ashwin as Bailey goes back and across and places it through midwicket
nicely flighted again as Maxwell is forced to lean forward and tap it to long-on
lunges forward as he goes for the slog sweep. Its all along the ground though, but the connection is good as Jadeja comes around the collects the ball
but Vinay apparently has not seen him as he bowls short and on the pads. All Maxwell had to do was help it off his hops and fine leg had no chance
he gets back outside off stump, where his fielders as the cut shot finds the man at point
127kph, full and on middle stump. Maxwell presses forward and clips it smartly in front of square
a little shape away for Vinay there as he bowles fuller and outside off. Bailey notes it and is happy to let it go to Dhoni
125.8kph, fuller again and on middle. Bailey stays in his crease and keeps it out
126.7kph, and he beats the outside edge with a lovely outswinger. Bailey was caught in the crease again as the ball was pitched a lot further up.
short and very little turn there means he pulls out a strong cut shot, which is collected by the man at sweeper cover
overcorrects as this is on the pads. But the batsman only knocks it off into the leg side
Gets a little forward seeing this one flighted a little more and taps it down to long-on
continues to toss it up does Ashwin and Bailey is happy to knock it straight down the ground
this one pitches on leg and turns further down as Dhoni moves smartly to collect it behind the wicket. Easy wide call there for the umpire

lovely flight there from Ashwin again. And this time his line is better as he angles it on off stump. And the turn he gets makes sure Maxwell's defensive prod does not connect as the ball hits his gloves
hint of inward movement as the good length ball is punched down to mid-on

dropped Ashwin dives to his right at midwicket as Bailey goes for an old fashioned slog to a length delivery on middle stump. A thick inside edge takes the ball in the air, but the fielder cannot hold on
poor from Unadkat this time. It was a shortish ball and Maxwell climbed on it. The pull shot was hit quite hard, but the man at deep square leg makes decent ground but his dive was ill timed
corrects his length as this one is on the off stump corridor. Maxwell calmly pushes it to the covers
good ball to end the over. On a length outside off and Bailey is still a little reluctant to go fully forward or fully back as he prods it to cover
fuller outside off stump and is driven to long-on effortlessly
attacks outside the off stump with a nicely flighted ball, but the batsman is already on his knees as he sweeps it to deep square leg
oh, a little turn and Maxwell had to adjust quickly. It was a little shorter and he was right in going back to cut, but the turn made sure his original full blooded cut was just a little dab to point
fuller on middle stump as Maxwell presses forward and clips it off his pads into the leg side
he is happy to meet this flighted ball on middle stump with a calm forward defensive
holds this a little bit back which allows the batsman to get back in his crease and work it through midwicket
angles it into the batsman's leg stump, who nurdles it to the the right of Ashwin at short fine
slow turn there which Maxwell adjusts to as he opens the face of the bat and dabs the length ball to point
another fullish length ball as Maxwell leans forward and blocks
this time he employs more of a push as the flighted ball is driven to long-on
fullish again and Bailey is on his front foot with a solid block
oh, what a delicious ball. Darted in on middle stump, forces the batsman to come forward with a dead bat. But the ball turns right across the face and just misses the off stump as well
smashed! Ashwin comes back over the wicket and it proves to be a hefty mistake as Masxwell charges him and lofts him over extra cover. Powerful strike
full and on off stump, but this one is just pushed back to the bowler
that was the carrom ball. Maxwell picked it late as he opened the face of the bat and nudged the full length ball to mid-off
Another carrom ball from Ashwin, this time the batsman goes back to pull it but doesn't connect
on a good length, and it dips a little as the ball is outside off stump. Maxwell blocks it away
excellent come back. Tossed up on middle as the batsman meets it with a straight bat
a little shorter there and the batsman exploits it, going nicely back and flicking it through midwicket.
back on an off stump line and Bailey respects it, getting forward and defending
quicker on at 92kph. And this one doesnt turn either. Bailey was not expecting either thing to happen as his forward defensive results in an inside edge
this time he is more solid, with a longer stride forward and blocks it back to the bowler
opens the face to turn this fuller ball outside off stump through point
and its the straighter one to start with as Bailey connects with only the outside edge of the bat, and the ball trickles through point
shorter and on middle as Maxwell turns it around to midwicket
reaches the pitch of that and what a difference it makes. Doesnt matter how the ball turns from there as he hits through the line of that ball and bangs it over wide long-on
holds it back a little as was expected by Bailey who clips it through midwicket, collects an easy single and raises his fifty
another one that is bereft of too much flight and Maxwell is happy to nudge it thorugh midwicket off the back foot
ah, better. Slower and tossed up which makes Bailey come forward and present a straight bat
tossed up on off stump and Maxwell lifts it over cover. Handsome stroke but only for a single
fuller length again, but the batsman plays it with soft hands and rush through for a single with the man at point being slow to the ball
thick outside edge but he was looking to open the face of the bat anyway. Quick running gets two runs as third man is slow this time
89.8kph, he keeps this on the fuller side as well as Maxwell gets forward and works it through square leg
tossed up on off stump and Bailey stays leg side of it to nudge it to cover
nicely flighted to start with and Maxwell drills a cover drive to the man inside the 30-yard circle
this time he gets nicely forward and turns the well-flighted ball outside off stump through midwicket
short, down the leg side, bye bye ball. Bailey rocks back and pounds it over the top and the ball races away to the square leg boundary
tossed up on middle as Bailey steps forward and drives to long-off
Yuvraj persistes with his flight and the batsman are just as good with their running. A little nudge into the on side fetches two

this time he is short and wide outside off and Maxwell tucks himself to an easy boundary through point. All he had to do was place it wide of the man at sweeper cover and so he did. Poor start from Yuvi
fullish ball, on a good line outside off. Bailey employs a lovely late cut and with the fielder at third man not as alert as he should be, the batsmen pick up a well-run two
drags the slower ball short and even if it was outside off, Bailey opens up his stance and pulls it as hard as he could. Doesnt get all of it as the man at deep midwicket comes around to stop it
another fullish ball outside off, but it is still negotiated off the back foot as he dabs it to third man
fine leg was up, he had to keep it outside off stump, but Unadkat targeted the middle of the pitch on leg stump and Maxwell leapt up onto one foot and pulled it over the man inside the circle
on a good length outside off. Maxwell rocks back, sways away to make a little room for himself and cuts it strongly to deep point

Yuvraj sticks out his hand as he dives to his left, but he has dropped it. It was short and wide, hardly deserving a wicket. But that could well have happened as Maxwell watched his cut shot go dangerously close to Yuvi. But all is well for Australia. Very tough chance through
starts off with a good length ball on middle which is turned around behind square on the leg side
another on that is angled on the pads and Bailey works it away through square leg
darted this one in quicker as but Maxwell brings his bat down in time
fuller on middle again as Maxwell pushes it down the ground to long-on
straying too straight again and that is easy for Bailey to clip through square leg for a couple
steps down the track, but he isn't interested in a big stroke having realised he was not to the pitch and blocks it down the ground
and he is smacked. It was a length ball but he had a hugh forward stride in and and slog sweeps him handsomely over square leg to mark is fifty
steaks away off the outside edge as the full length ball runs off fine of the man at point
he's lost faith in flighting the ball. Shortish and ample room for Maxwell to rock back and slam it  wide of sweeper cover, who makes good ground to keep it to two
stretches forward and pushes the length ball on off down the ground
this time he targets middle as Bailey presents a dead bat
short and quick from Raina as the batsman goes back and pushes down the ground

oh huge shout there and it seemed very very close. But Umpire Vineet Kulkarni is unmoved. Its' runs! But it did not look quite so clear. Another dart from Raina and the batsman was too slow as he looked to go back and cut it. He was dead to rights in front of all three stumps. And Shikhar Dhawan runs in from short third man and nails the captain on his left hamstring with his throw as the batsmen take a single
another dart on leg stump from Raina and Maxwell flicks it off the fine leg
pushed down the ground. Raina dives to try and stop it but he would never have reached it
comes forward and defends the full length ball on off stump
darted in on off stump as Bailey blocks it off the front foot
this time he goes back but still cannot make too much of it. straight bat back to the bowler
another dart from Jadeja as the batsman gets his bat down in time to protect his stumps
ventures down the track, but Jadeja bowls it a little wider. Bailey is equal to it as he cuts it through point for a couple
easy single down to long-on as the batsman stretches forward and drives down the ground
oh, that was a gimme ball and Maxwell obliged and how. He passed his highest score in ODIs a while ago and celebrates it with a punishing pull over midwicket
flatter ball on middle and Maxwell pushes it down to midwicket
no flight there either, but Maxwell plays the line of the ball, pushing it to long-on off the front foot
oh, that is top-notch placement. It was a short-armed jab and it certainly did not look to be heading to the boundary. But Bailey had perfectly bisected the two deep men on the leg side
orthodox pull shot this time as Raina persists with short pitched darts. Bailey has gotten used to the pace of the Indian spinners and comfortably beats the man at deep square leg
and he nudges this fuller one to long-on to retain strike
opens the face of the bat as Vinay settles into a good length on and around off stump. Third man comes into play, but its only a single this itme
confident push to a length ball on off stump. He was on the back foot and the ball had taken the inside half of the bat
short of a length outside off and he opens the face to dab it to point
124.2kph, as he looks to nudge this one through midwicket, but the ball was too full and he should have been forward if he wanted to do that
stays back, but this was short of a length and he needed his height to get on top of the bounce and push it to cover
oh, another pathetic ball. Short and asking to be hit and Bailey was in no mood to reject such a lovely gift. Slams it well to the straight of midiwcket as Kumar his head
full and just a touch outside off stump as Maxwell steers it through point
a little turn there, but it is easily negotiated as the batsman goes back and across, waits for the ball to do its bit and pushes it down the ground
this time his wait is in vain. no turn and Maxwell adjusts and punches it to cover

dropped that is how it is going to go down on the scoreboard. Maxwell's late cut takes the glove and Dhoni who was already rising could not hold on to the ball as it deflects off his glove as well. Another tough chance put down
more work for deep midwicket as the ball on middle stump is worked away off the front foot
angles it into the pads and it hits him on the knee-roll. But the ball was always heading down the leg side and the batsmen sneak a leg bye
full and outside off, Bailey attempts a cover drive, but the ball takes a thick outside edge and scurries away to the third man boundary. Bailey has a wry smile
that time he nails it. It was the same ball, perhaps a little fuller and Bailey slams it off the front foot to beat the four men on the off side in field
stays back to meet the short of a length ball outside off and guides it down to third man
drilled to mid-off. His yorkers are coming through as half-vollets and if that had been slammed a little to either side of the fielder it would have been four
another on full and on off stump and Maxwell drills it straight to mid-off for the second time.
86 kph, pitched on a length and whisked away to the leg side
88 kph, Maxwell goes for the lofted reverse sweep, almost a switch hit, as this one clears the extra-cover boundary with ease. Maxwell looking very dangerous here
87 kph, and he goes for it again with another lofted reverse sweep through the extra-cover region for four
Maxwell works this down to long on
87 kph, shortish length that is clipped behind square off the leg side
good stop from Yuvi, Maxwell made room to a low full toss and drove it to the right of extra cover, Yuvraj tumbles across and saves a boundary

124 kph, and Bailey will not go on to score a century as he top-edges this short delivery to deep midwicket, where Rohit Sharma takes a safe catch to remove the Australian captain. Unfortunate end to what has been a stand out innings. An innings that truly put Australia back in the driver's seat
126 kph, on a good length and just outside off, Maxwell moves across and defends it towards the off-side
126 kph, shortish delivery outside off which is cut away to the fielder
127 kph, back of a length delivery taken off the pads and clipped behind square on the leg side
127 kph, length ball on the pads which is worked away behind square
126 kph, too full and wide and Maxwell helps himself with a sweetly timed cover drive to the boundary
tossed up and on off, Haddin gets forward and defends it
worked this away for a couple to deep midwicket
pulls out the straighter one which pitches on a length on middle and off, with Haddin covering for the spin. Jaddu strikes and India trying to ebb away at the momentum gained by Australia
darted in on middle and defended carefully by Faulkner
almost identical delivery from the last with the same result
similar delivery, this time straying on the leg side, as Faulkner defends carefully
on a length and just outside off, Maxwell plays with an angled bat and dabs it towards point
127 kph, shortish delivery which is cut away outside off to the fielder
124 kph, advances down the track to this back of a length delivery to try and angle the ball through third man, but short third man is ready in anticipation
125 kph, Maxwell has all day to take this banged in delivery straying down the pads and lifts this over fine leg for a huge six. Lovely shot there
128 kph, Maxwell looking to eschew this behind point, but fails to get bat on ball

127 kph, and it looks as if Maxwell will not get a maiden century as a fuller length delivery on middle jags just a bit in and hits under the knee roll. Looked adjacent the moment it struck, and Richard Kettleborough confirms the decision. But when the replay is looked at for a front-foot no-ball, it appears Vinay has just got some part of his foot behind the line. Almost touch and go there
85 kph, pitched on a good length on middle before turning sharply towards the leg side, which the batsman fails to get away
85 kph, fuller length outside off as Faulkner is able to turn it away to the leg side
86 kph, defended back to the bowler
86 kph, once again defended on the front foot
91 kph, quicker one which the batsman does well to cover
84 kph, fuller length on middle and off which is defended carefully
91 kph, Faulkner pushes this down to long off for a single
95 kph, darted in just outside off and worked away to long on
Jadeja fires one short and just outside off, chopped to the left of backward point for a single
93 kph, length ball which is defended to the leg side
tossed up and on off, Johnson gets well forward and drives it to long on for a single
91 kph, pitches on a good length and defended back to the bowler
89 kph, length ball on middle which Johnson defends to the leg side
86 kph, Raina drifts one on the pads, Johnson looks to defend and misses, the ball rolls away towards the on-side
87 kph, worked away to midwicket for a single
Raina keeps it full and on off, driven to the right of Raina who dives and saves a single
flighted and on off, Johnson plays with an open face and pushes it towards the off-side
90 kph, darted in on middle and defended back to Jadeja
length ball on off and middle which is defended on the front foot
once again defended on the front foot
fuller length outside off which Faulkner sees off
Faulkner finally able to get off strike as he squirts this square on the off side
gets a single to retain the strike for the next over with a gentle clip on the leg side
flighted and on off, Johnson defends it with a straight bat
pitched up on middle and worked away through extra-cover by Johnson
flatter and outside off, Faulkner makes room and mistimes the cut towards cover
short ball which is whipped away to deep midwicket
Raina keeps it full and on off, defended back to the bowler
length ball outside off which gets a thick edge through to third man
88 kph, darted on the off stump as Faulkner eases this through to mid off
89 kph, Johnson gets on the back foot to attempt to work this away to the leg side
Johnson able to get this away to point
length ball which is worked away for a single
Jadeja gives this one more air, driven back to the bowler
short and should have been walloped, but instead ends up at square leg
91 kph, quicker one which is defended back to the bowler
90 kph, Johnson steers this through midwicket for one
length ball and worked away to the leg side
turned away to square leg with Jaydev firing in a throw, but can not prevent the extra run
pushes this to the right of Raina to get a single
Faulkner provides a good finish to the over with a four through extra-cover
Johnson gets on one knee to sweep this powerfully through deep midwicket for four
pitched up on and around off as Johnson goes for a slog sweep, which ends up getting top-edged up in the air, and Raina just makes a hash of it, making that the fourth dropped catch of the innings
Faulkner able to work this away to cover
Johnson now hits it like he means it with another slog sweep being powered over the midwicket boundary
a little slower as Johnson rocks back to direct this towards extra-cover
Faulkner able to steer this away to the off side to keep himself on strike
pitched on leg as Faulkner goes for the sweep round the corner, with the ball hitting the pad
same line again as Faulkner goes for another swing, but misses it. Still able to run the extra
slows this one down a bit as Johnson tries to flay this through the off side
slow again as Faulkner goes for a slog, but mishits it behind square
this time fires in the quicker one as Johnson advances down the track, but misses the ball entirely with his slog, with Dhoni quick on his feet to stump the left hand fast bowler
McKay gets off the mark straight away with a pull to the square leg boundary for two

134 kph, right in the blockhole straight away as Faulkner hits this to the leg side, with Shami recovering the ball and turning around quickly to throw down the non-striker's end, and in all that commotion, the fielder backing up throws that at Dhoni's end who whips off the bails. TV umpire called in, but no one was run out, and two runs are added to the tally
speared in again on middle and off as Faulkner pushes this down to long off
short ball as McKay goes for the pull through midwicket for a boundary
yorker length ball on middle as McKay is able to dig it out to the leg side for a single
in the blockhole again as Faulkner is able to clip it through midwicket for another two

low full toss as he searches for the yorker, with the ball lofting up to mid off, with Shikhar Dhawan making the dive to take the catch, but unable to hold on to it, such is the story of India's fielding this innings.

inn2.comm: full and a hint of swing away, but Johnson provided too much room. Rohit leans into a good looking drive that is placed between mid-off and cover to get off the mark
much tighter and he uses a shorter length as well. Rohit gets back and works it off his hips for a single
one bounce four only it's byes. 150 kph says Matt Hayden. Excellent short ball and Dhawan is equal to it as he sways out of the line as that sails over middle stump and over the keeper's head
148 kph, on a good length as Johnson's slingy action makes it bounce and swing away more as it goes through to the keeper. Haddin does well to stretch a little extra and collect it
open face of the bat in play, despite the two slips, but this one was shorter and easily negotiated to third man
another pacy short ball, right over the off stump, to finish the over and Rohit drops his wrists and sways out of the way. Well, it looks like the mean Johnson has showed up at this game
complete contrast to Johnson as he bowls a full length, on and around off stump. Dhawan gets forward and times his drive to smack into the hands of cover
just on that corridor outside off again as Dhawan stays on his back foot and lets it go
129.5kph, and it allows Dhawan to skip down the track and slash it through point. Typical Dhawan on the up drive square through the off side.
and again, but this time he's a little quicker. 131 kph. Dhawan had put no though to placement as he just looked to whack the ball, and only manages an inside edge back ot the bowler
oh, that almost shaved the off stump! Brave leave from Dhawan as he watches the length ball pitching on middle and seaming just a tad away
another excursion down the track, but this time McKay doesnt give any room and Dhawan tries to work it off his pads, but misses
138.8kph, full and wide and Rohit eases into a gorgeous cover drive that finds the fielder
homes in on middle with a full length ball. Rohit responds with a forward defensive, bat and pad very close together
back of a length, and no room offered. Its the kind of length Australia have profited from bowling outside the subcontinent. Here though Rohit just tucks to square leg
wayward there. Far too wide outside off, but Rohit who doesn't get his back foot closer to the ball, misses wildly
149.9kph, cranking it up here is Johnson and that hits the batsman's glove and balloons over to where forward square leg would normally be placed
149.6kph, short again but this time Rohit is quicker on the hook, but he still doesnt get all of it as the ball flies in the air toward square leg.
slapped over cover again. Dhawan is happy to leave the safety of his crease and exploit the fullness and width of this ball.
looks like that's his plan against McKay. Charges him and when the bowler tucks him up for room, he nudges it behind square on the leg side and takes the single
tentative from Rohit. This was on a fullish length outside off and it seams just a hint inward. The batsman wanted to defend, but then changed his mind and pulled out very very late
takes a leading edge and goes in the air toward midwicket as he looks to clip the full length ball on middle. But the man is a little too deep

solidly behind it as the length ball on middle is met with a defence. But the throw from the fielder at cover, Faulkner, nearly takes out Rohit as he returns the ball to the keeper. Rohit sways away just in time as the ball runs away to the boundary, but it is a dead ball as the fielder was not looking to run the batsman out
unlucky for McKay, his full length gets a little away movement, which dupes Rohit's forward defensive. The ball takes the outside edge and flies past the right of the diving second slip

148.3 and that pace helps the batsman this time. The ball was short and angled in at Dhawan, who was looking to help it off to fine leg. He doesn't connect with the bat, but the ball takes the thigh pad and goes off to the boundary
